What book is The movie Jill Rips based on?

The movieJill Rips is based on the bookJill Ripswritten by  Frederic Lindsay

Jill RipsPublished by Andre Deutsch Limited - 1/1/1987

The Stranger from Home

written byFrederic Lindsay

Published by DI Jim Meldrum Mystery - 1/1/2008

Escaping to America from the turmoil of her life in Edinburgh, DI Jim Meldrum's daughter, Betty, is lonely and vulnerable. When she meets a witty, charming stranger with an accent that reminds her of home, she is swept into a whirlwind romance that ends in marriage. But why does her new husband evade any question about his background? What secret is he hiding? Meanwhile, back in Edinburgh, Jim Meldrum has become involved in the search for the missing wife of prominent local businessman Barry Croft. Though none of his colleagues can be persuaded to take her disappearance seriously, Meldrum is convinced the case will end in the revelation of a violent death. As his investigation of Croft begins to uncover the reality of a complex man addicted to sex, Meldrum is disturbed by Betty's return alone from America. Shortly afterwards, Meldrum gets a visit from two federal marshals, who tell him that Betty's husband has fled to Edinburgh and they have come to find him and take him back. As Meldrum strives to protect his daughter, questions of guilt and redemption confront him with the hardest choices of his life.

After the Stranger Came

written byFrederic Lindsay

1/1/1992

Story about a psychotic hypnotist and his devasting effect on the life of a Scottish professor's wife.

Did you know that the movie Jill Rips is based on the book Jill Rips?

Matt Sorenson (Dolph Lundgren), a former boxer and San Francisco cop, now makes a living collecting debts for small businesses. The brutal death of of his high powered younger brother, Michael, changes all that forever. Intent on finding his brother killer, Sorensen infiltrates the powerful inner world of politics, business intrigue and casual sex. Rejecting the police and media theory that the murder is the work of a female prostitute, Sorensen's focus falls on the corrupt big city businessman, Jim Conway. His obsession to discover the killer's identity mounts a a series of other men are found murdered in a similar fashion. Sorensen looses all objectivity and becomes a one man vigilante

  • Internet Movie Database:  4.0/10
